revised_title: Investigating the Factors Influencing Drop Size and Formation
tldr: This article explores the factors that influence the size and formation of drops, focusing on drops formed under fixed and determinable conditions. The author discusses the role of self-attraction, adhesion, shape, medium, and gravitation in drop formation and presents a series of experiments to study these factors. The findings show that the size of drops is affected by the growth-time and the rate of dropping, with a minimum drop weight occurring between specific growth-time intervals.
